virtual void Optimize ()
 Virtual function for optimizig data structures. Optimized data structures take less RAM and their indexes are sorted for quicker access. Sorting is done automatically as new data is added to the category. If the category is edited (fields/data removed), it may need optimization and re-sorting for efficiency.

The sorting preserves the order of actual appearance of tags in mmCIF file. If a category is created programmatically, the order of tags in mmCIF file will be the same as order of adding them to the category.
void Sort ()
 Sorts category's data for quicker access. The sorting is essentially re-indexing of data for quicker access. It does not change the order of data in both mmCIF hierarchy and mmCIF file. E.g., if tag "serial_no" was 2nd one in given category before sorting, it will remain on 2nd place after it, therefore no change in tag number passed to functions in mmcif::Struct, mmcif::Loop and mmcif::Data.

Detailed Description

mmcif::Category is a base class for mmcif::Struct and mmcif::Loop, implementations of mmCIF's "structure" and "loop" categories.

This class is not instantiated independently in any applications, however, it provides a few public functions which work for both mmcif::Struct and mmcif::Loop.

All data in mmCIF hierarchy is addressed using construct "category.tag" plus row number (>=0) for loops. Category names should always start from underscore, while tags normally start with a letter, e.g. "_barrel.id".

See general principles of working with mmCIF files and mmCIF hierarchies in Section "mmcif_handler".

Member Function Documentation

int mmdb::mmcif::Category::AddTag ( cpstr  ttag )

Adds a tag to the category. Adding a tag in mmcif::Category does not reserve any placeholder for the corresponding value. All tags get automatically sorted (reindexed) for quicker access. Tags will appear in mmCIF file in order of their addition to the category.

Parameters:
[in]ttagtag to be added.
Returns:
>=0 the tag is already in the category, and return is its serial number. No changes to the category is done
<0 the tag was added to the list of tags, and return is minus total number of tags in the category.
bool mmdb::mmcif::Category::CheckTags ( cpstr *  tagList )

Returns true if all tags from the list are found in the category. The size of the list of tags may be less than the number of tags in the category, and order of tags is disregarded.

Parameters:
[in]tagListlist of tags to be checked for presence in the category. The list must end with NULL pointer, or your program will crash.
Returns:
true if all tags from the list were found in the category
false if one or more tags from the list were not found in the category.

Example: 

  cpstr tagList[] = {"id","type","date",NULL};
  mmcif::Struct cifStruct;
  if (cifStruct.CheckTags(tagList))
    printf ( " all tags are found in category %s\n",
             cifStruct.GetCategoryName() );

This function is useful for finding categories in "dirty cifs", where category name is not given.

void mmdb::mmcif::Category::Copy ( PCategory  Category ) [virtual]

Deep copy of categories. Deep copy duplicates all data and memory allocations, producing a genuine clone of the original. Only deep copy should be used for copying MMDB objects, a mere assignment operator will fail you.

Parameters:
[in]Categorya pointer to mmcif::Category, the content of which is copied into 'this' category.

Reimplemented in mmdb::mmcif::Struct, and mmdb::mmcif::Loop.

virtual MMCIF_ITEM mmdb::mmcif::Category::GetCategoryID (  ) [inline, virtual]

Returns category type. This function may be used when retrieving categories (structures and loops) from data blocks (mmcif::Data).

Returns:
MMCIF_Category for mmcif::Category
MMCIF_Struct for mmcif::Struct
MMCIF_Loop for mmcif::Loop

Reimplemented in mmdb::mmcif::Struct, and mmdb::mmcif::Loop.

pstr mmdb::mmcif::Category::GetTag ( int  tagNo )

Returns tag with the specified serial number. The tags are enumerated as 0..GetNofTags()-1.

Parameters:
tagNotag's serial number
Returns:
NULL: tagNo is outside the range of 0..GetNofTags()-1
not NULL: tag in tagNo'th position
int mmdb::mmcif::Category::GetTagNo ( cpstr  ttag )

Returns serial number of a tag in the category.

Parameters:
[in]ttagtag (or name of a field in category)
Returns:
>=0 : the tag is in given position
<0 : the tag was not found, but it could be inserted before tag with (-rc-1)th index, where 'rc' is the return.
void mmdb::mmcif::Category::InitCategory (  ) [protected]
void mmdb::mmcif::Category::Optimize (  ) [virtual]

Virtual function for optimizig data structures. Optimized data structures take less RAM and their indexes are sorted for quicker access. Sorting is done automatically as new data is added to the category. If the category is edited (fields/data removed), it may need optimization and re-sorting for efficiency.

The sorting preserves the order of actual appearance of tags in mmCIF file. If a category is created programmatically, the order of tags in mmCIF file will be the same as order of adding them to the category.

Reimplemented in mmdb::mmcif::Struct, and mmdb::mmcif::Loop.

void mmdb::mmcif::Category::PrintTags (  )

Prints list of tags to stdout. Both sorted and unsorted tags are printed to standard output. This function may be used for debugging.

void mmdb::mmcif::Category::SetCategoryName ( cpstr  N )

Sets category name.

Parameters:
Nnew category name
void mmdb::mmcif::Category::Sort (  )

Sorts category's data for quicker access. The sorting is essentially re-indexing of data for quicker access. It does not change the order of data in both mmCIF hierarchy and mmCIF file. E.g., if tag "serial_no" was 2nd one in given category before sorting, it will remain on 2nd place after it, therefore no change in tag number passed to functions in mmcif::Struct, mmcif::Loop and mmcif::Data.

Reimplemented in mmdb::mmcif::Struct, and mmdb::mmcif::Loop.
